intro: Anaphalis yakusimensis, commonly known as the Yakutian goatweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Siberia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers form a cylindrical or conical shape. Anaphalis yakusimensis is adapted to harsh climates and plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its native habitat.
